Which of the following BEST facilitates the identification of appropriate key performance indicators (KPIs) for a risk management program?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Evaluating KPIs in accordance with risk appetite
Keywords are risk management KPI and risk appetite

Selected Answer: B
The best way to facilitate the identification of appropriate key performance indicators (KPIs) for a risk management program is B. Evaluating KPIs in accordance with risk appetite.

Risk appetite is the level of risk that an organization is willing to accept. By evaluating KPIs in accordance with the organization’s risk appetite, you can ensure that the KPIs reflect the organization’s strategic goals and risk tolerance. This approach helps to align the risk management program with the organization’s overall strategy and objectives.
